intro: Uragoga lasiophthalma, commonly known as the rough-leaved uragoga, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
